title: Kubernetes v1.35: A Better Way to Pass Service Account Tokens to CSI Drivers
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-09, Reading time: 4 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fkubernetes.io%2Fblog%2F2026%2F01%2F07%2Fkubernetes-v1-35-csi-sa-tokens-secrets-field-beta%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdevops/1/0100019ba2bbec84-228ee830-5bd9-4d80-98c9-dcb27717b525-000000/hNe2g7d4UWra_mDSF8ncYUcPlq3peicZ7T9xL6hBa90=439
summary: Kubernetes v1.35: A Better Way to Pass Service Account Tokens to CSI Drivers (4 minute read) Kubernetes v1.35 introduces a beta opt-in solution for CSI drivers, enabling them to securely receive service account tokens through the `secrets` field in `NodePublishVolumeRequest` instead of the less secure `volume_context`. This addresses past logging vulnerabilities, such as CVE-2023-2878, by providing a safer, more consistent method for handling sensitive data.

title: Why we're leaving serverless

title: PostgreSQL 18 RETURNING Enhancements: A Game Changer for Modern Applications
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-09, Reading time: 7 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.pgedge.com%2Fblog%2Fpostgresql-18-returning-enhancements-a-game-changer-for-modern-applications%3Futm_source=tldrdevops/1/0100019ba2bbec84-228ee830-5bd9-4d80-98c9-dcb27717b525-000000/KsuEsqjzNXrcSjtCzpi-lJcA0jKq8tYj_6XH01Yez0M=439
summary: PostgreSQL 18 RETURNING Enhancements: A Game Changer for Modern Applications (7 minute read) PostgreSQL 18 significantly enhances the RETURNING clause by introducing OLD and NEW aliases across INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, and MERGE, enabling developers to access before-and-after row values in a single atomic statement. This removes the need for triggers or extra queries, simplifies change tracking and auditing, and makes MERGE-based upserts far more powerful and maintainable.

However, Cloudflare Radar data showed eleven similar, likely accidental, Type 1 hairpin route leaks by CANTV since early December, indicating the issue stemmed from insufficient routing export and import policies rather than malicious intent.

summary: Kernel bugs hide for 2 years on average. title: std::move doesn't move anything: A deep dive into Value Categories
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-12, Reading time: 38 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2F0xghost.dev%2Fblog%2Fstd-move-deep-dive%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdev/1/0100019bb2300f73-ceac9e06-172d-4e15-a195-2b7ea602b7fd-000000/BpMGqHaAvADu3fY9V8M3yWVhaARu-rIVXctTxZuJ8Po=439
summary: std::move doesn't move anything: A deep dive into Value Categories (38 minute read) `std::move` in C++ is a misnamed function that doesn't physically move data, but rather casts an expression into an rvalue reference, signaling that its resources can be "pillaged." This conversion allows move constructors and move assignment operators to efficiently transfer ownership of resources, usually by swapping pointers, instead of performing expensive deep copies.

It functions as an efficient, low-level compilation target, allowing devs to bridge language gaps, integrate high-performance code (like C++) into web environments, and run many languages efficiently.

title: In AI Agents, Traces Are the Source of Truth

summary: In AI Agents, Traces Are the Source of Truth (4 minute read) In AI agents, the code only orchestrates models and tools, while real decision-making happens inside the model at runtime and cannot be understood by reading the code alone. summary: How to Steal Any React Component (6 minute read) It's possible to "steal" or reconstruct any React component from a production website, even without access to its source code. You can generate a component's code by collecting multiple examples of a component's props and its resulting HTML and feeding it into an LLM.

summary: YAML? title: Ethereum Must Pass the Walkaway Test
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-13, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fthreadreaderapp.com%2Fthread%2F2010621884811845708.html%3Futm_source=tldrcrypto/1/0100019bb781c864-39446d0b-5bde-49c9-ad4a-0bedf0f90412-000000/TzbOn1efqVAIPnNQhKZLOCwzpPTGgoW9ohkrRXWgISk=440
